headline.main: SERVICES ADHERE TO PRESS POLICIES; Davis's Right to Direct Them Is Questioned by Some High Officers of Army and Navy WIDE POWERS CONFERRED War Information Chief Has Kept Out of Dispute Pending Centralization of System

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 2 -- The authority of Elmer Davis, director of the new Office of War Information, to control the release or suppression of military information is being questioned by some high officials of the War and Navy Departments, who do not concede to him a right to direct their policies.
abstract: E Davis' authority in mil information release through OWI questioned by army and navy officials; Col Donovan's duties as Joint Psychological Warfare Com chmn described

byline.original: By JAMES B. RESTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
